title: The metabolic benefits of exercise, muscle mass, and protein intake
content: If you want to be metabolically healthy, the best thing you can do is have lots of lean body mass. Muscle/ lean body mass is a metabolic sink. Obese powerlifters may have some elevations in blood lipids and whatnot, but usually their insulin sensitivity and blood glucose are okay. Exercise is one of the only things that we know of that without even weight loss improves metabolic health substantially, really substantially. A high dose of exercise is not required. Just going and being sedentary to walking 100 minutes a week, and you will see improvements in health markers.

title: The importance of muscle mass
content: No one ever says, I wish I had less muscle. You have a lot more you can get away with, with a lot of muscle mass. Older and frail people don’t think about this [muscle mass]. People say, “You do all that heavy lifting, you’re going to be in pain when you’re older”. But you’re going to be in pain when you’re older regardless. Do you want to be in pain and strong or in pain and weak?

title: The dangers of being immobile
content: Sitting is to lower back pain what bourbon is to alcoholism. The worst thing you can do is be immobile.
